name: Arelith Divine Smiter: Fighter 10/ Paladin 6/ CoT 14
author: Valerfor

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
(EDIT by Stagmeister with invaluable input from Mick Dagger. This build arose from a challenging request, which Valerfor once again proved more than capable of meeting.)


This was a tough one, for the amount of time I had.  Obviously, he cannot ALSO have a great AB, this is simply the case with great smiters.
This is all about the smiting aspect of him, because when he lands one it's gonna hurt, a lot.
On a non-critical, totally mundane, improved-wrathful-smite he hits for 1d10+11+10+7+5+120 dmg, double that on crits, so make the smites count!
His defenses are good despite the lack of armor skin & full tumble because of divine shield. His saving throws are, simply put, amazing.

posts.author: Stagmeister

They're Arelith-specific, it's a level 30 persistent world, and has its own rules and changes to standard ones (such as the gifts, and having to take at least 3 consecutive levels when you take a new class, but there are sub-races and all sorts of other malarkey). Afraid you can't take them with vanilla rules.

Cheers

eltalstro
posts.content:
Hey Val, 

This is pretty awesome, but it's even more awesome than you think. I came here for inspiration for an Arelith divine build and decided to plug your build into the Arelith version of the character creator and the AB it spits out is 36 (which is pretty solid at level 30). This is because, 'while wielding a melee weapon, Divine Champion gains 1 passive Attack Bonus per 5 class levels. This bonus is reduced by 2 if hard Charisma is lower than 20, or 1 if hard Charisma is lower than 24. The passive Attack Bonus bonus will not go below 0.' So if somehow the CoT levels could be bumped up by 1 it would increase AB by another point. It looks, in the picture, like I haven't included the major gifts, but I have. For whatever reason, I can't get those to work so I just raised STR and CHA by 2 up top.

Cheers,
Eltalstro
